column1: Baraguá (Spanish pronunciation: [baɾaˈɣwa]) is a municipality and town in the Ciego de Ávila Province of Cuba. Its administrative seat is located in the town of Gaspar.
The municipality occupies the south-eastern part of the province
column2: and the area is dominated by mangrove.
the municipality of Baraguá had a population of 32
column3: 408. With a total area of 728 km2 (281 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 44.5/km2 (115/sq mi).
